notes: Seed entries are extracted from high-confidence recurring signals in listed resources.
Price ranges are operational seed ranges and should be refreshed with periodic market scans.
Glossary entries are marked needs_native_review for linguistic QA before production use.
Includes curated extraction from Lonely Planet Â· Pocket Marrakesh 7 (PDF, 161 pages), processed on 2026-02-07.

items.title: Tea hospitality matters
items.summary: Mint tea is both beverage and social ritual; accepting politely is often appreciated in host settings.
do: Acknowledge tea service with thanks
Ask for no sugar if needed
dont: Do not assume refills are free in commercial settings

items.title: Medina rhythm is intense but navigable
items.summary: The medina environment is sensory-dense; pacing and short reset breaks improve confidence.
do: Plan short navigation legs
Use landmark anchors
dont: Do not force a rigid minute-by-minute route

items.title: Clarify hammam format before starting
items.summary: Hammam experiences vary widely from local basics to spa packages with many add-ons.
do: Ask what is included before undressing/changing
Confirm expected duration
dont: Do not assume massage is included

items.title: Bargain politely and specifically
items.summary: In souk contexts, calm and specific counter-offers generally work better than aggressive haggling.
do: Counter with a clear number
Compare multiple shops before final purchase
dont: Do not negotiate without intention to buy

items.title: Respect Ramadan timing differences
items.summary: Meal timing and venue rhythm can shift significantly during Ramadan periods.
do: Check opening windows in advance
Keep flexible meal plans near sunset
dont: Do not assume normal daytime service everywhere

items.title: Rooftops are social and scenic spaces
items.summary: Rooftops are frequently recommended for evening reset and broad city orientation.
do: Use rooftops as low-stress transition points
dont: Do not block high-traffic photo points during busy hours

items.title: Many traditional meals are communal
items.summary: Traditional dining may include shared dishes and bread-based eating patterns.
do: Ask how dishes are meant to be shared
Respect table pacing and host flow
dont: Do not assume Western-style course timing

items.title: Family-centered social norms are strong
items.summary: Family values are highly visible in daily life, and children are generally welcomed warmly in public spaces.
do: Expect and reciprocate warm family-oriented interactions politely
Build itineraries that include child-friendly pauses and shared meals
dont: Do not misread child-focused attention as unusual in local context

items.title: Djemaa El Fna is a living performance heritage space
items.summary: The square is framed as an intangible-heritage stage shaped by storytellers, musicians and evolving performer traditions.
do: Approach the square as a cultural space, not only a photo stop
Use heritage museums nearby to understand performer traditions
dont: Do not treat performers as props without clear consent

items.title: Public behaviour tends to be conservative
items.summary: Public norms in Morocco are generally conservative, including around affection and social display.
do: Use respectful, low-key public behaviour in shared spaces
Align dress and body language with local context in heritage areas
dont: Do not assume nightlife areas reflect norms everywhere

items.title: Business and prayer rhythms shape opening patterns
items.summary: Many businesses follow Monday-Friday routines, while medina shops may close or slow on Friday prayer periods.
do: Keep Friday schedules flexible in medina-heavy plans
Confirm opening windows during Ramadan and holidays
dont: Do not assume fixed hours across all neighbourhoods and seasons

items.title: Smoking prevalence is high in many social venues
items.summary: Smoking and vaping remain common in many bars and restaurants, though banned in taxis and public transport.
do: Choose seating and venue types accordingly if smoke-sensitive
Use transport rules as a boundary in closed vehicles
dont: Do not assume smoke-free indoor dining by default
